artist: Johann Joachim Kändler; Manufacturer: Meissen Porcelain Factory
creditline: The Christina N. and Swan J. Turnblad Memorial Fund
medium: Hard paste porcelain with enamel and gilded decoration
object_name: Plate, Pair of armorial plates from the Swan service
text: This plate comes from the most famous service manufactured by Meissen during the eighteenth century. Known as the Swan Service, more than 2, 200 pieces were created to serve dinner, coffee, tea, and chocolate. The decorative theme is water, as seen in this plate's swans and bulrushes, modeled in low relief. Each piece carried the arms of Brühl and his wife Maria Anna Fransizka von Kolwrat-Krakowska, who were married in 1734.  Count von Brühl served as director of the Meissen factory, and hence, had the access and means to order several services in different patterns from the workshops.
title: Armorial plate from the Swan service, one of a pair
